summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting a video conference interview conducted on May 20, 2021, with an individual referred to as 'Ji m' (likely a redaction). The interviewee provides information about Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell's alleged financial schemes, arms dealing, money laundering through non-profits, and connections to various wealthy individuals. The interviewee also describes personal threats and legal battles stemming from their investigations.

persons.name: Lara Pomerantz
persons.context: Conducted the interview over video conference.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as running a Ponzi scheme in the 80s, being an arms dealer, controlling governments, and laundering money through non-profits like Southern Trust.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as a facilitator of Epstein's enterprise, involved in pyramid schemes and money laundering. Launched Terramar.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Mentioned as someone whose name 'crosses over' and who moved Epstein into his home office. Known to the interviewee's husband.

persons.name: Andrew Farkas
persons.context: Named as a friend and partner of the interviewee's husband. Co-owned a house with Epstein and was involved in moving arms.

persons.name: Walter Forbes
persons.context: Was partners with the interviewee's husband in the late 90s. Was put in jail in 2007 after the husband uncovered he was 'cooking the books'.

persons.name: Yoni Scortis
persons.context: Was hiding out in Cyprus. The interviewee filed a lawsuit against him and was in litigation for 5 years.

persons.name: Marvin James
persons.context: The interviewee called her insurance and met with him. He later took her to the United States embassy.

persons.name: Adrian Fox
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Sebastian Bastien as moving women and arms.

persons.name: Sebastian Bastien
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Adrian Fox as moving women and arms.

persons.name: Craig Flowers
persons.context: Partners with Russians. Associated with Buckle Management which created software for a Bahamas government contract.

persons.name: Sofia Joelsson
persons.context: Former Miss Sweden, helped facilitate Maxwell and Epstein, including sponsoring employee visas.

persons.name: Barbara Embrow
persons.context: Helped Maxwell and Epstein exploit women.

persons.name: Georgette Mossburger
persons.context: Helped Maxwell and Epstein exploit women.

persons.name: Eric Price
persons.context: From Blackwater, targeted the interviewee and her husband.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as a facilitator of Epstein's enterprise, involved in pyramid schemes and money laundering together.
Co-owned a house and were involved in moving arms together.
Leon Black moved Epstein into his home office.
Were partners in the late 90s before the husband exposed Forbes's fraud.
Worked together moving women and arms.
Joelsson helped facilitate Maxwell and Epstein, including sponsoring visas.
Both helped Maxwell and Epstein exploit women.

events.title: Walter Forbes Jailed
events.description: Walter Forbes was put in jail after the interviewee's husband uncovered he was 'cooking the books'.

events.title: Move to Bahamas
events.description: The interviewee and her husband went to the Bahamas while she was pregnant, following threatening calls stemming from Epstein.

events.title: House Demolition
events.description: The house co-owned by Epstein and Farkas was demolished in August 2013.

events.title: Husband's Stroke and Lockdown
events.description: The interviewee's husband had a stroke, she had a baby, and they locked all their containers as she grew suspicious.

events.title: Home 90% Complete
events.description: The interviewee's home was 90% complete in November 2014.

events.title: FBI Interview
events.description: The interviewee provided information to AUSA Lara Pomerantz and law enforcement about Epstein, Maxwell, and their associates.

keyFacts: The interviewee alleges Epstein and Maxwell ran a pyramid scheme, money laundering operation, and that Epstein was an arms dealer who used waterways for shipping.
Epstein and Andrew Farkas co-owned a house involved in arms movement, and the property reportedly had 12,000 feet of underground tunnels.
Epstein allegedly controlled an algorithm called 'Southern Trust' which generated $200 million in 5 years and was used to launder money through non-profits.
The interviewee claims to have been targeted with threats and legal battles, losing $11 million in legal fees, after her husband exposed financial crimes.
Several individuals, including Sofia Joelsson, Barbara Embrow, and Georgette Mossburger, are named as facilitators who helped Maxwell and Epstein exploit women and sponsor visas.
